item.title: 原住民团体要求智利法院暂停对 Codelco-SQM 锂交易的社区审查
item.description: 据路透社查阅的法律文件显示，智利北部的两个原住民团体要求当地法院暂停国家主导的社区审查程序，该程序是铜业巨头 Codelco 与锂矿商 SQM 之间的锂矿合作所必需的。【原文：Two Indigenous groups in northern Chile have asked a local court to suspend a state-led community review process that is required for a lithium partnership between copper giant Codelco and lithium miner SQM , according to legal documents reviewed by Reuters.】

item.title: 美联储主席洛根表示，她的基本预期是再维持一段时间利率稳定
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行行长洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）周二表示，面对特朗普政府关税带来的上行压力，美国央行可能还需要在一段时间内维持利率不变，以确保通胀率保持在较低水平。【原文：The U.S. central bank will probably need to leave interest rates where they are for a while longer to ensure inflation stays low in the face of upward pressure from the Trump administration's tariffs, Dallas Federal Reserve Bank President Lorie Logan said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普贝森特是接替美联储主席的一个选择，"但我喜欢他的工作
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二表示，财政部长斯科特-贝森特可能成为接替美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔的候选人，但他也暗示这可能不会发生。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent could be a candidate to replace Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell, but suggested that might not happen.】

item.title: 特朗普政府起诉驱逐公共广播公司董事会成员
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府周二对公共广播公司的三名董事会成员提起诉讼，尽管特朗普试图解雇他们，但他们仍未离职。【原文：President Donald Trump's administration filed a lawsuit on Tuesday against three board members of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting who have not left their posts despite Trump's attempt to fire them.】

item.title: 在中国经济的韧性之下，是减薪和副业的生活
item.description: 中国国有企业员工张金明每天晚上下班后和周末送三个小时的外卖，以弥补工资减少 24% 的损失--他希望这样可以避免与同事发生尴尬。【原文：Chinese state firm employee Zhang Jinming makes up for a 24% cut to his salary by delivering food for three hours every night after work and on weekends - and hopes he can avoid awkward encounters with colleagues.】

item.title: 力拓第二季度铁矿石产量环比增长 13
item.description: 力拓（Rio Tinto）周三报告称，第二季度铁矿石发货量连续增长 13%，从今年早些时候与极端天气有关的中断中反弹。【原文：Rio Tinto , reported a 13% sequential rise in second-quarter iron ore shipments on Wednesday, rebounding from extreme weather-related disruptions earlier this year.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：特朗普下令帮助向私人市场开放退休计划
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二援引知情人士的话报道，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普预计将在未来几天内签署一项行政命令，旨在帮助美国退休计划更多地利用私人市场投资。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to sign an executive order in the coming days designed to help make private-market investments more available to U.S. retirement plans, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 备忘录称，美国国民警卫队在 2024 年遭到 "盐台风 "的 "大范围 "黑客攻击
item.description: 根据国土安全部的一份备忘录，美国一个州的陆军国民警卫队网络被一个绰号为 "盐台风 "的中国网络间谍组织彻底入侵。【原文：A U.S. state's Army National Guard network was thoroughly hacked by a Chinese cyberespionage group nicknamed "Salt Typhoon," according to a Department of Homeland Security memo.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会终结 Cognizant 贿赂案，司法部也放弃了该案
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）决定停止执行一项重要的反腐败法律后，美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）结束了对两名前科知技术解决方案公司（Cognizant Technology Solutions）高管的民事贿赂案。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission ended a civil bribery case against two former Cognizant Technology Solutions executives, after President Donald Trump decided to stop enforcing a key anti-corruption law.】

item.title: 美国农业机构终止支持小企业的计划
item.description: 美国农业部周二表示，将削减对一个全国性中心网络的资助，该网络为数千家中小型农场和食品企业提供了支持。【原文：The U.S. Department of Agriculture said on Tuesday it would cut funding for a national network of centers that have supported thousands of small- and mid-sized farm and food businesses.】

item.title: 交易日 债券低迷股市低迷
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 电子邮件称美国证交会罢免会计监督机构负责人
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一封发给员工的电子邮件，美国证券交易委员会已将负责监督上市公司审计师的美国监察机构的负责人推了出去。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has pushed out the head of the U.S. watchdog that oversees public company auditors, according to an email to staff seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 广告部门增长强劲，奥姆尼康收入超出预期
item.description: 广告公司宏盟集团（Omnicom）周二公布的第二季度业绩超出华尔街预期，主要得益于广告和媒体业务的增长。【原文：Advertising firm Omnicom on Tuesday beat Wall Street estimates for the second quarter, fueled by growth in its advertising and media segment.】

item.title: 巴西希望在最后期限前解决美国关税问题
item.description: 巴西副总统杰拉尔多-阿尔克明（Geraldo Alckmin）周二表示，巴西将努力争取美国在对巴西商品征收50%的关税于8月1日生效之前撤销该关税。【原文：Brazil will work to get the United States to reverse 50% tariffs on Brazilian goods before they are set to take effect on August 1, Vice President Geraldo Alckmin said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 英格兰银行贝利支持国际货币基金组织帮助解决全球经济问题
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）周二表示，国际货币基金组织在应对世界经济中风险失衡的积累方面可以发挥关键作用，其中许多风险失衡来自美国和中国。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said on Tuesday the International Monetary Fund had a key role to play in tackling the buildup of risky imbalances in the world economy, many of them coming from the United States and China.】

item.title: 加密货币法案在国会遭遇程序性障碍
item.description: 周二，国会对期待已久的加密货币立法的命运产生了疑问，因为审议这些措施的程序性投票被立法者否决了。【原文：The fate of long-awaited cryptocurrency legislation in Congress was cast into doubt Tuesday, as a procedural vote to consider the measures was shot down by lawmakers.】

item.title: 美国汽车安全提名人称机构不能等待自动驾驶汽车问题的解决
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统提名的美国最高汽车安全监管机构负责人将于周三告诉美国参议员，该机构必须在监督自动驾驶汽车和其他新技术方面发挥积极作用。【原文：President Donald Trump's nominee to serve as the nation's top auto safety regulator will tell U.S. senators Wednesday that the agency must take an active role in overseeing self-driving vehicles and other new technologies.】

item.title: 据当地媒体报道，墨西哥监管机构对受美国制裁的金融机构处以罚款
item.description: 据当地媒体周二报道，墨西哥银行监管机构在 6 月份对三家因涉嫌洗钱而受到美国制裁的金融机构处以超过 1.85 亿比索（约合 981 万美元）的罚款。【原文：Mexico's banking regulator slapped three financial institutions, which had been sanctioned by the U.S. for alleged money laundering, with more than 185 million pesos ($9.81 million) in fines in June, local media reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: Blackstone 与美国公用事业公司 PPL 建立合资公司，合作建设天然气发电厂
item.description: 宾夕法尼亚州电力和天然气公用事业公司 PPL 与 Blackstone Infrastructure 周二表示，两家公司已成立一家合资企业，根据长期能源服务协议建设天然气发电站，为数据中心供电。【原文：Pennsylvania electric and gas utility PPL and Blackstone Infrastructure have formed a joint venture to build natural gas generation stations to power data centers under long-term energy services agreements, the companies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国国防部官员称五角大楼将继续与美国稀土项目合作
item.description: 一位国防部官员周二告诉路透社记者，美国国防部计划继续与稀土公司合作，以确保美国在整个经济中使用的关键矿物的多样化供应。【原文：The U.S. Department of Defense plans to continue working with rare earths companies to ensure diverse American supply of the critical minerals used across the economy, a defense official told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美联储主席柯林斯敦促对利率保持耐心，并称关税冲击可能较小
item.description: 波士顿联储主席苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）周二表示，在当前经济不确定的情况下，她并不急于改变美国央行的基准利率，因为数据显示，虽然进口关税将推高通胀，但总体影响可能并不像人们曾经担心的那样糟糕。【原文：Boston Federal Reserve President Susan Collins said on Tuesday she's in no rush to change the U.S. central bank's benchmark interest rate amid current economic uncertainty, as data suggest that while import tariffs will drive up inflation, it's possible the overall impact may not be as bad as once feared.】

item.title: 花旗集团首席执行官称考虑发行自己的稳定币
item.description: 花旗集团首席执行官简-弗雷泽（Jane Fraser）在周二的财报后电话会议上告诉分析师，花旗集团可能发行自己的稳定币，以促进数字支付。【原文：Citigroup may issue its own stablecoin in an effort to facilitate digital payments, the bank's CEO, Jane Fraser, told analysts on a post-earnings conference call on Tuesday.】

item.title: 通用汽车提出 40 亿美元扩大天然气卡车和 SUV 生产计划
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）周二表示，该公司正在扩大其汽油动力 SUV 和卡车的生产，并将把凯迪拉克凯雷德（Cadillac Escalade）转移到密歇根州的一家装配厂，同时在同一工厂新增雪佛兰 Silverado 和 GMC Sierra 轻型皮卡的产能。【原文：General Motors said on Tuesday it is expanding production of its gas-powered SUVs and trucks, and will move its Cadillac Escalade to a Michigan assembly plant, while adding new capacity for Chevrolet Silverado and GMC Sierra light duty pickups at the same facility.】

item.title: 费列罗有望为注重健康的美国人重振 WK Kellogg 的销售业绩
item.description: Nutella 涂抹酱生产商费列罗拥有在健康监管严格的欧洲市场的经验和改造 Keebler 饼干等陷入困境的品牌的良好记录，上周宣布的 31 亿美元私有化交易很有可能重振 WK Kellogg 的传统谷物品牌。【原文：Nutella spread maker Ferrero, armed with experience in health-regulated European markets and a track record of revamping struggling brands like Keebler cookies, has a good chance of reviving WK Kellogg's legacy cereal brands with its $3.1 billion take-private deal announced last week.】

item.title: 高盛为纽约经济适用房项目融资 2.7 亿美元
item.description: 纽约州州长凯西-霍楚尔（Kathy Hochul）办公室表示，高盛集团将出资 2.7 亿美元在布鲁克林纽约东区建造 385 套经济适用房。【原文：Goldman Sachs will finance a $270 million affordable housing project to build 385 apartments in the East New York neighborhood of Brooklyn, New York Governor Kathy Hochul's office said.】

item.title: 摩根大通首席执行官戴蒙的言论凸显对美国经济的谨慎态度
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）数个季度以来一直对美国经济持谨慎态度，并在周二表示，准确的预测是一项挑战，因为关键的变化只有在事后才能显现出来。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has maintained a cautious stance on the U.S. economy for several quarters now and said on Tuesday accurate forecasts are a challenge because key shifts are apparent only in hindsight.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司首席执行官表示，美国对巴西征收的关税可能会像 COVID-19 一样打击巴西航空工业公司的收入
item.description: 巴西航空工业公司首席执行官周二表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划从8月起对巴西出口商品征收50%的关税，这可能会对巴西航空工业公司的收入造成类似于COVID大流行病的影响。【原文：The 50% tariff that U.S. President Donald Trump plans to impose on Brazilian exports starting in August could have an impact on the revenues of planemaker Embraer similar to that of the COVID pandemic, its CEO said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 抗议领袖称，矿工解除了对秘鲁铜矿要道的封锁
item.description: 抗议活动的领导者之一路易斯-瓦曼（Luis Huaman）周二告诉路透社记者，秘鲁的矿工已暂停抗议活动，这些矿工获准使用临时许可证进行开采，他们的抗议活动已阻断了一条主要的铜矿运输路线长达两个多星期。【原文：Miners in Peru who have been allowed to operate with temporary permits have paused protests that blocked a major copper transit route for more than two weeks, one of the protest leaders, Luis Huaman, told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: Roblox 推出知识产权授权平台，与 Netflix 和狮门影业合作
item.description: 本周二，Roblox 在其电子游戏平台上推出了一项许可功能，允许知识产权持有者将自己的角色和世界整合到游戏中。【原文：Roblox launched a licensing feature on its videogame platform on Tuesday, allowing intellectual property holders to integrate their characters and worlds into its games.】

item.title: 米拉-穆拉提的人工智能初创公司 Thinking Machines 在早期融资中估值 120 亿美元
item.description: 由前 OpenAI 高管米拉-穆拉提（Mira Murati）创建的人工智能初创公司 Thinking Machines Lab 周二表示，该公司在风险投资公司 Andreessen Horowitz 领投的一轮融资中以 120 亿美元的估值筹集了约 20 亿美元。【原文：Thinking Machines Lab, the artificial intelligence startup founded by former OpenAI executive Mira Murati, said on Tuesday it has raised about $2 billion at a valuation of $12 billion in a funding round led by venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz.】
